child.geography: The proto-Tsous left for Ali Shan
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: Headed north from the Seediq region
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: The proto-Saisiyats moved northwest from Proto-Atayalic
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: Headed north from the central part of the island
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
child.pub-comments: "The northern Formosan subgroup proposed by Li (Li 1985) is supported, though weakly, as F7" (Starosta 2005: 693).

child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: The Philippines; subsequent southward movements were the beginnings of the great Malayopolynesian migration into the Pacific
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
child.pub-comments: Starosta indicates that this node includes other languages/groups not listed here, such as those of the "Philippines, etc." (1995: 718).

child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
child.pub-comments: "The remaining language in this study, Yami, does not subgroup grammatically with any of the other Formosan languages, supporting the generally accepted conclusion that it belongs rather with the Batanic languages of the Philippines" (Starosta 1995: 718).

child.geography: Crossed the ocean to Botel Tobago
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: Some of those left behind on the coast moved down the valley toward the southern end of the island and, after exchanging some morphology with the earlier Rukai settlers they met along the way, evolved into the Paiwans.
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
child.pub-comments: "F10 is not a strongly supported subgroup. It is characterized by only two innovations[…] Subsequent research could well result in separating the two into independent branches of Eastern Formosan, or in supporting Reid's Amis-Extra-Formosan" (Starosta 1995: 716).

child.geography: Crossed the mountains through the Taroko Gorge and arrived in the Taitung rift valley
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: Remained in the place of F6
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: Somewhere in the interior of Taiwan
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: F4 evolved in situ into F5, in connection with a migration up the Choshui River valley into the central part of the island.
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: The proto-Kanakanavus moved into a position between the Tsous and Saaroas
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: F3 evolved in situ into F4
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: The proto-Chamorros headed out to sea; they rounded Ouluan Pi and headed out into the Pacific, arriving eventually in the Marianas.
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
child.pub-comments: "According to this scenario, Chamorro's stikingly Filipinic features, previously used as evidence for a Philippine connection (cf. Topping 1973:3) actually on closer inspection give Chamorro a place in Formosan prehistory" (Starosta 1995: 707).

child.geography: F2 evolved in situ into F3
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: F1 evolved into F2, in situ
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: F0 evolved in situ (southwest coast of Taiwan) into F1
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

child.geography: The proto-Rukais moved inland up the Lower Tamshui River valley toward the modern Rukai area
child.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.

root.publications: Starosta, Stanley. 1995. A Grammatical Subgrouping of Formosan Languages. In Dah-an Ho, Ying-kuei Huang, Paul Jen-Kuei Li, Cheng-hwa Tsang & Chiu-yu Tseng (eds.), Austronesian Studies Relating to Taiwan, 683-726. Taipei: Symposium Series of the Institute of History and Philology.
root.pub-comments: "The use of shared morphological innovations produces a subgrouping picture which equates Proto-Formosan with Proto-Austronesian, interprets morphological evidence for the putative Rukai-Tsouic subgroup as retentions rather than shared innovations, identifies almost all extra-Formosan languages as a relatively low-level subgroup of the Austronesian family, and for the first time posits Chamorro to be a mid-level offshoot of the Formosan family tree" (Starosta 1995: 683).
